content:
## What is an ArrayList?

The `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) class is used to represent a list of elements that are of the same type. With an `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea), elements can be added or removed at any time, making it more flexible than a one-dimensional (1D) array.

## How do I use an ArrayList in my program?

The `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) class is part of the `java.util`(#e7e8ea) package. To use it, add the following line to the top of your program:

```
import java.util.ArrayList;
```

Creating an `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) object is similar to creating a 1D array. Instead of square brackets ( `[ ]`(#e7e8ea) ), we use angle brackets ( `< >`(#e7e8ea) ) to specify the type.

```
ArrayList<DataType> foo = new ArrayList<DataType>();
```

::: details [**‚ùìWhat is `foo`(#e7e8ea)??**]
  
`foo`(#e7e8ea) is a name often used by software engineers in example code segments as a placeholder for a variable, object, or method name. You can read more about how this word is used and theories about its origins [**here**](https://www.codingem.com/what-is-foo/).
:::

## How do I modify elements in an ArrayList?

The `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) class has several methods for adding, modifying, and removing elements. Take a look at [**the documentation**](https://studio.code.org/docs/ide/javalab/classes/ArrayLists) for the `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) class to view its methods and examples.
